Package OrderingSystem

Class Computations

java.lang.Object
OrderingSystem.Products
OrderingSystem.Computations
Direct Known Subclasses:
Cart
class Computations extends Products
Handles all of the computations that will happen throughout the program.

This class's parent class is Product class.

Author:
Kian Candelario

  • Method Details

    • totalPrice

      public int totalPrice​(int selectedCategory, int index, int quantity)
      Computes the total price by multiplying the price of the product to the preferred quantity of the user.

      This method uses conditional statements to determine the category which is important because the Video Games and PC Peripheral have their own subcategories. The conditional statements contains switch statements which will be used to determine the right Arrays that will be indexed.

      The switch statements uses the value of gameType and selectedPeripheral variables which values originated from the Main class and has been passed to the Product class.

      This method can access the gameType and selectedPeripheral variables without instantiating an object because Computations class inherits the Product class.

      Parameters:
      selectedCategory - the category number that was selected by the user.
      index - the product number that was selected by the user subtracted by 1.
      quantity - the entered amount of product the user wants to buy.
      Returns:
      the product of the item's price multiplied to the user's entered quantity

    • totalShipping

      public int totalShipping​(int shippingFee)
      Multiplies the cost of shipping fee to the number of elements inside the ArrayList finalPrice
      Parameters:
      shippingFee - the cost of shipping fee
      Returns:
      the product of the cost of shipping fee multiplied to the number of elements inside the ArrayList finalPrice.

    • totalCost

      public int totalCost()
      Computes the total cost by getting the sum of all of the elements inside the ArrayList finalPrice by iterating the ArrayList and adding the elements one by one using a for-each loop.
      Returns:
      the sum of all of the elements inside the ArrayList.

    • totalCost

      public int totalCost​(int shippingFee)
      Computes the total cost by getting the sum of all of the elements inside the ArrayList finalPrice by iterating the ArrayList and adding the elements one by one using a for-each loop, then adding the result to the total cost of shipping fee.

      This method is similar to the totalCost method showed earlier, except that this method has a parameter. This is called Method Overloading.

      Parameters:
      shippingFee - the total cost of shipping fee.
      Returns:
      the sum of all of the elements inside the ArrayList added to the cost of shipping fee.

    • changeComputation

      public int changeComputation​(int payment)
      Computes the change by subtracting the user's payment to the total cost of the ordered items by the user.
      Parameters:
      payment - the payment entered by the user.
      Returns:
      the difference of payment subtracted to the total cost of ordered items.

    • changeComputation

      public int changeComputation​(int payment, int shippingFee)
      Computes the change by subtracting the user's payment to the sum of the total cost of the ordered items and total cost of shipping fee.

      This method is similar to the changeComputation method showed earlier, except that this method has two parameters instead of one. This is called Method Overloading.

      Parameters:
      payment - the payment entered by the user.
      shippingFee - the total cost of shipping fee.
      Returns:
      the difference of payment subtracted to the sum of total cost of ordered items and total cost of shipping fee.
